title: KPMG ITA vs Accenture Interactive Digital Marketing Analyst

replies.msg:
小弟黎緊19 grad, 收到呢兩個offer, 想問咁多位巴絲點簡好

KPMG IT Advisory: 人工穩定, IT前景好 (e.g. Cyber Security)

Accenture Interactive Digital Marketing Analyst: Accenture名氣大過Big4, 但想知Accenture Interactive係咪都一樣? 會唔會話廢d? 同埋諗緊digital marketing長遠人工會唔會冇Cyber Security既工咁promising?

你地會點簡？

replies.msg: 我只係個煙腸都唔係特別熟，但ACN Digital 喺consulting嚟講其實比較散，比起Business Consulting下其他branches嚟講，好多工都係外判或者non-consulting role，你呢個analyst都唔係consulting profile嚟，但ACN Digital旗下三個branches (Applied Intelligence, Accenture Interactive, Industry X.0)嚟講Accenture Interactive算係再偏向Agency啲嘅款，我只係做幾個月所以唔清楚Analyst -> Consultant條path點同埋快定慢，但我見到唔少有4-5年經驗嘅同事可以入嚟公司一兩年到就由Analyst/Designer role升到management role，如果你想轉去management consulting/ digital consulting㗎話可能做幾年之後讀個master會好啲？

quote.msg: 我雖然只係個學生但都可以幾肯定咁同你講accenture會好啲，之前都收到Accenture Interactive同PwC Experience Centre嘅offer，最後揀咗accenture interactive，其實AI只係ACN Digital Consulting下其中一個分支嘅agency，偏marketing多啲，唔太稱得上係consulting，巴打咩背景？

我只係個煙腸都唔係特別熟，但ACN Digital 喺consulting嚟講其實比較散，比起Business Consulting下其他branches嚟講，好多工都係外判或者non-consulting role，你呢個analyst都唔係consulting profile嚟，但ACN Digital旗下三個branches (Applied Intelligence, Accenture Interactive, Industry X.0)嚟講Accenture Interactive算係再偏向Agency啲嘅款，我只係做幾個月所以唔清楚Analyst -> Consultant條path點同埋快定慢，但我見到唔少有4-5年經驗嘅同事可以入嚟公司一兩年到就由Analyst/Designer role升到management role，如果你想轉去management consulting/ digital consulting㗎話可能做幾年之後讀個master會好啲？

replies.msg: 如果照你咁講 要4-5年經驗+做多1-2年先上到management role咁好似big4抵屌d? big4 5年就manager同埋出面好多其他4as/other agency都可以做7-8年做到manager 我好似唔係好睇到Accenture interactive個優勢

兩邊都識人 exp hire 過左去做
kpmg ita 應該有得做多 d 唔同 projects e.g. cybersecurity, it audit, it strategy, it pmo
accenture 聽過有人係 interactive 做 digital strategy, design thinking 呢類
promotion 黎講可能 kpmg 仲易少少，不過起薪低
kpmg: 2年 consultant ->3年 senior consultant -> manager
accenture: 2-3 年 analyst -> 3-4 年 consultant -> manager

做梗 Accenture Interactive！入左一定後悔 ！
點解

replies.msg:
Business - It is in fact a digital agency, but bound by the consulting practice... this is where causing frustration - "Chargeability" is the key killing point, this makes project cost high and not competitive in market, leaders will try to use low level staff to fulfill the positions to cut cost Staff engagement - "Chargeablility" is again killing, it makes you feel like a product being traded for charging client money - It's like doing your own business, you'll need to "market" yourself to different people, esp. leadership - You can't get the project or role you really want if you're not "social" enough - You need to have "relation" with and "got known" by leaderships, if you want to get promoted - Your contribution on actual projects are not evaluated fairly, you'll be judged as not capable if you're not chilling out around

Work/projects - Role/project assignment is not really that open, there's an internal portal for role search but actually most jobs are not posted there for searching freely, usually project leads will source the staff offline and then mark it back to the system, so it's again a "relation" game - You'll be asked to do business development work when you're not on project, the work can be something you totally don't know or not in your specialties, and the worst is not the profession you're growing toward - The business development often not done by specialized team but only whoever on bench, within a short timeframe, actually nothing you can learn in deep - When you got no project, you'll be challenged by your dropping chargeability level (again, "chargeability"!!), but they won't give you a project even you want to - Worst is if you’re not “chargeable” for a longer period, you’ll be forced to go for project with domain you’re not specialised in, without checking your willingness in advance; You will be brought in front of the project lead and refuse it by yourself, it's embarrassing and no benefit for everybody

Benefits - Actually there're not too many classroom trainings in HK, most are video records of online trainings/webniars - Benefits are not extremely attractive The most terrible is no sign from leadership or management that these are problems hurting staff engagement, they'll think it's the employees’ problems

quote.msg: 做梗 Accenture Interactive！入左一定後悔 ！
點解

Business - It is in fact a digital agency, but bound by the consulting practice... this is where causing frustration - "Chargeability" is the key killing point, this makes project cost high and not competitive in market, leaders will try to use low level staff to fulfill the positions to cut cost Staff engagement - "Chargeablility" is again killing, it makes you feel like a product being traded for charging client money - It's like doing your own business, you'll need to "market" yourself to different people, esp. leadership - You can't get the project or role you really want if you're not "social" enough - You need to have "relation" with and "got known" by leaderships, if you want to get promoted - Your contribution on actual projects are not evaluated fairly, you'll be judged as not capable if you're not chilling out around

Work/projects - Role/project assignment is not really that open, there's an internal portal for role search but actually most jobs are not posted there for searching freely, usually project leads will source the staff offline and then mark it back to the system, so it's again a "relation" game - You'll be asked to do business development work when you're not on project, the work can be something you totally don't know or not in your specialties, and the worst is not the profession you're growing toward - The business development often not done by specialized team but only whoever on bench, within a short timeframe, actually nothing you can learn in deep - When you got no project, you'll be challenged by your dropping chargeability level (again, "chargeability"!!), but they won't give you a project even you want to - Worst is if you’re not “chargeable” for a longer period, you’ll be forced to go for project with domain you’re not specialised in, without checking your willingness in advance; You will be brought in front of the project lead and refuse it by yourself, it's embarrassing and no benefit for everybody

Benefits - Actually there're not too many classroom trainings in HK, most are video records of online trainings/webniars - Benefits are not extremely attractive The most terrible is no sign from leadership or management that these are problems hurting staff engagement, they'll think it's the employees’ problems

replies.msg: Ching u are working as what post?介唔介意share做左幾年貼人工而家大概幾多

quote.msg: 做梗 Accenture Interactive！入左一定後悔 ！
